column5: All, I Am in the process of doing my research for my 2024 trip. Couldn't make it to Nakina this year due to a variety of factors. I'd appreciate information on Twin Lake Outfitter VanPoele Lake camp. I saw one YouTube on the camp but any insight and impressions would be appreciated as well. Thanks in advance!

I'll be in that camp one week from today for the week, hit me up after that for an update. I've fished Kag a couple times and its just a short boat ride to get to it and its a walleye factory. Easy to fish and big enough to never urn out of new water to explore.
Thank you for the reply. I will be sure to hit you up upon you return. Best of luck with your upcoming trip and I will be anxious to hear what you have to say.

We've been there twice and going in early Aug. Excellent camp as Fishquest said short ride to the Kag for your chance for a triple header with the option of Van Poole if bad weather/wind is a factor. Fishquest I know you will post a report as I'm curious about the large fires to the east. Stay Safe

For sure when I return I'll make sure to get back for update. Looks like we are heading into a cool rainy week up there next week, i'm figuring the cold front will make fishing tough but still better than working.

Sounds good, you know the area so it will be great and better than this heatwave we're having. The choke point 5 min west of camp was double header heaven for a warm up before heading to the Kag last year on Van Poele. Safe trip
What dates are going to VanPoele?
When I went to Kag the first week of July in 2014, the outflow from Van Poele into Kag was on fire! Tons of walleye and a 40" pike the morning we went there.
We fly out Aug 7, meal planning in check and started packing. Can't wait to go back. Stay Safe
Have a great time and let me know how you did.
